channel.title: Laptops
channel.description:
First of all guys, sorry for posting a question...
Now, im looking to get a laptop and i have a small budget. I have found a god looking laptop and i was wondering if these specss are good..
8gb RAM dual channel 1tb hard drive (aprox. 1100gb) 17.3in screen Intel core i5 processor 2.0-3.10ghz turbo boost I forget but it does have wifi
For 650$
Will that be good for java coding, game playing, and like everyday shit

item.title: Laptops
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“Kidpaparoach, post:45, topic:440099”][quote author=Taharok link=topic=542781.msg3981792#msg3981792 date=1335372054]

I have a laptop and it hasen’t been outside my house since I can even remember.

Using this as an addendum to my last post:

I take my laptop with me everywhere I go. Literally everywhere. Unless I’m going to the local store or something, it’s always with me. I use it during school, during my free time, after school, on planes, in cars, etc. @OP: If you are planning on something similar, obviously go with a laptop. But if you like always being in one place while programming or gaming, there’s no point.
[/quote]
You use your laptop too much by the sounds of it…[/quote]

All of my jobs and side projects involve programming, so I need to.

Read full topic

item.title: Laptops
item.dc:creator: @chillwitm888 chillwitm888
item.description:
@chillwitm888 wrote:

[quote=“SilentCJ, post:56, topic:440099”][quote author=chillwitm888 link=topic=542781.msg3982090#msg3982090 date=1335393641]
My computer lags while editing films…
…AMd athlon II dualcore processor at 2.75ghz
[/quote]
There’s your problem.

As long as you have over 4GB RAM you probably won’t need any more unless you do heavy video editing and rendering. 4GB is definitely enough for any game on the market today.
It’s primarily the processor (and GPU in gaming) that makes the difference.

Ivybridge has just been released a couple of days ago so if possible I’d wait it out for the next gen laptops (and desktops) which will feature these CPU’s, the performance difference will be noticeably better.

Quite simply my specs are, 3gb ram, i4 2.6ghz proccessor, 1.5gb gfx card, 1tb hdd 32bit system.

Intel Core i4? Sounds legit. Probably mean pentium 4?[/quote]
Loael.
and at mine response
I noticed but this computer is like 3 years old if not more.
I am not going to get a new computer anytime soon. 2 years till college and i am asking for a macbook
U guise probablie h8 macs
owell.
I like mac, i like to do work and edit stuff using apples unique os and their unique programs such as final cut
imov garageban etc
They are really nice

Read full topic

item.title: Laptops
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

[quote=“chillwitm888, post:54, topic:440099”]My computer lags while editing films…
…AMd athlon II dualcore processor at 2.75ghz[/quote]
There’s your problem.

As long as you have over 4GB RAM you probably won’t need any more unless you do heavy video editing and rendering. 4GB is definitely enough for any game on the market today.
It’s primarily the processor (and GPU in gaming) that makes the difference.

Ivybridge has just been released a couple of days ago so if possible I’d wait it out for the next gen laptops (and desktops) which will feature these CPU’s, the performance difference will be noticeably better.

Kidpaparoach:

Quite simply my specs are, 3gb ram, i4 2.6ghz proccessor, 1.5gb gfx card, 1tb hdd 32bit system.

Intel Core i4? Sounds legit. Probably mean pentium 4?

item.title: Laptops
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

[quote=“chillwitm888, post:54, topic:440099”][quote author=Kidpaparoach link=topic=542781.msg3982085#msg3982085 date=1335393415]

point is, im getting the 1TB because i dont want to use all of it, i want as much free space at any given moment as possible… thus making the laptop run a little smoother… also the 8GB RAM is a lot because i FUCKING HATE LAG!

Almost never lag on my tiny 3gb ram pc. only times I lag is when lets say editing a movie while running a game n a bot then it’ll lag a bit. 8gb is excessive, tis up to you though.
Disregard the advice your asking for if you want:)
[/quote]
what kind of processor do you have? you probably have a i3 or i5 or higher processor
My computer lags while editing films, and I have 6gb of ram.
My processor is a AMd athlon II dualcore processor at 2.75ghz[/quote]
Quite simply my specs are, 3gb ram, i4 2.6ghz proccessor, 1.5gb gfx card, 1tb hdd 32bit system.

Read full topic

item.title: Laptops
item.dc:creator: @Fridder Fridder
item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

[quote=“202685, post:50, topic:440099”][quote author=Fridder link=topic=542781.msg3981937#msg3981937 date=1335383444]

yes, i have a low budget and 700$ wont get me any desktop ever

What?

Go ahead and buy the computer. You probably will never use up 1TB on a laptop, but its always good to have.
You can do what I’m currently doing now. Find a shitty laptop and attempt to make it useful. I just found an old laptop from 2009 or so that would overheat after 10 minutes and wouldn’t start up (from a nasty virus off limewire). The battery is currently completely dead and I need to plug it in for it to work. So I installed Windows 7 and bought new fans with a laptop cooling pad and a new mouse. Gave it 2GB of RAM and now I can play minecraft on it for more than an hour.
[/quote]

ZOMG MINECRAFT FOR AN HOUR!?!?!?![/quote]

Yeah. I don’t play minecraft because its boring.
It can handle runescape. I used minecraft as an example because minecraft needs a lot of memory to run.

Read full topic

item.title: Laptops
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

Acorn_:

A laptop will never be good for coding or game playing.

There are laptops specifically engineered for media. Ie, mine:

http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16834246326&nm_mc=TEMC-RMA-Approvel&cm_mmc=TEMC-RMA-Approvel--Content--text-_-

@OP: If you aren’t willing to put a lot of money forward for a laptop, you’re only going to get a half-decent machine. With your budget, you may be better off buying a desktop unless you really have a good reason for requiring a laptop.

Read full topic

item.title: Laptops
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

My specs quite simply are 1.5gb gfx card 3gb ram i4 2.6ghz 1tb hdd and i’ve yet to encounter something I can’t do on my pc so people going its okay are talking shit unless they mean for your budget.
I’d say focus on your processor and then your gfx card but they aren’t too expensive. 8gb of ram is pointless on a i5… for your budget your perfectly fine but laptops aren’t that good for gaming and i don’t even see why your saying java… You can have a crappy pc and be able to do java fine…?
Desktop + a good phone if your on the move a lot is all you need. Laptops are faaar more expensive than pc’s(that aren’t budget ones) and there isn’t a need in most cases for one.

Read full topic
